venue.name: 1/2 Mile East on Route 113A from Wonalancet

item.description:
Oh yeah, I forgot... Bill T. is running it! :)

 

This hike in lieu of the Mt. Chocoura hike scheduled for this date.

This is a rainy day hike, below tree line, fewer rocks, moderate incline, no rock scrambling.  There will be views from various outcroppings.  Safety is the #1 concern.  It is rated as a MODERATE hike.

Trail Distance: 7 miles

Elevation gain: 2,000 feet

Summit Elevation: 3,083 feet

Estimate Time: 7 hours with rain factored in.

Cabin Trail

Rainy Day Preparations.  In addition to ordinary day pack gear, Rain gear, hat, insulating layer, water-resistant boots.  In your pack, include a small towel, flashlight and change of socks.  Hiking poles will be useful.

We will turn around if conditions warrant.

Topo map is here
http://tinyurl.com/8feht6c

My cell number is 781 799 2930

Disclaimer: As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.name: Mt. Paugus on a Rainy Sunday
